intro: Sasaella leucorhoda, commonly known as the white-flowered sasa, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender,丛生 (clump-forming) growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in panicle inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a bluish-green hue that becomes more pronounced in the shade. Sasaella leucorhoda is often found in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, temperate climates.
